Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces

Interface ICmdEncDecLib

  • public interface ICmdEncDecLib
    An interface for Command Encoding and Decoding Library.

    Note: can not exist a method that receives a JSON object because this module has to be JSON implementation independent (does not need any particular JSON lib).

    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Method Detail

      • build

        ICommand build​(java.lang.String sJSON)
        Returns the runtime command represented by received JSON string.

        Only runtime commands (IDevice, IDriver, IRule and IScript) are serialized and deserialized. The INCLUDE and USE are commands used only by the transpiler: the ExEn knows nothing about them and therefore there is no need to be serialized and deserialized them.

        Parameters:
        sJSON -
        Returns:
        The command instance represented by received JSON string.

      • unbuild

        java.lang.String unbuild​(ICommand cmd)
        Returns the String that represents this instance in JSON format (according with the Une format specification).
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to unbuild.
        Returns:
        The String that represents this instance in JSON format.

      • checkProperty

        java.lang.Object checkProperty​(java.lang.String sPropertyName,
                               java.lang.Object oPropertyValue)
        This method allows to check DEVICE INIT parameters.
        The action is kind of a SET (not a GET): the method can receive a value.

        For Devices, this method returns:

        • Boolean.TRUE if it has a method named sPropertyName that receives a value of type oPropertyType.
        • Boolean.FALSE if it does not have a method named sPropertyName.
        • NUmber.class, String.class or Boolean.class if it has a method named sPropertyName but oPropertyType is of wrong type: returned class is the right one.

        These are the properties used by DEVICE INIT clause.

        As CILs are loaded at runtime and their implementations can will be different, the only way to know if they support a property is by asking the CIL implementation.

        Clearly this arises an incompatibility issue, but we think it is better to accept this. Any case, in the future it can be evaluated the convenience of setting a "common-set" that all CIL implementations have to implement.

        Parameters:
        sPropertyName - The property name to check its validity. Can not be null.
        oPropertyValue - The value of the property to check its validity.
        Returns:
        Boolean.TRUE | Boolean.FALSE | the right proper type if it was wrong

      • about

        java.lang.String about()
        Returns information about this CIL implementation.
        Returns:
        Information about this CIL implementation
